title: HDFC sells $717 million of home loans to reduce credit book
description: HDFC Bank has sold a housing loan portfolio worth 60 billion rupees and car loans worth 90.6 billion rupees to various state-controlled banks and asset management companies. This move aims to reduce its retail loan portfolio amid regulatory pressures to improve credit-deposit ratios, which have worsened due to rapid credit growth and its merger with Housing Development Finance Corp.
